intro: Atractylodes japonica, commonly known as Japanese Atractylodes, is a perennial herb native to East Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its hairy, rhizomatous root system. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with lanceolate leaves and yellow flower heads. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or mountainous regions. The rhizomes are valued in traditional medicine for their purported health benefits.
